description: recto: head of a bald man with long dark moustache, beard and eyebrows, in profile from PR, at center; drapery studies at right (very light); seated figure study, ULC; two studies of hands and one of foot, LRQ; verso not examined (received framed)
medium: Black and white chalk on laid paper
provenance: [Pietro Scarpa, Venice, before 1973; sold for 190,000 lire, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (by 1973-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Head of a Bald Man in Profile and Sketches of a Seated Man and of Drapery (recto); Sketches of a Male Head and Arms (verso)
